description: This Swift source file defines the 'GameViewModel' class for managing the state and logic of a Tic-Tac-Toe game in an iOS app using SwiftUI. It includes game state management, player turn handling, win/draw detection, and UI-related properties.

classes.name: GameViewModel
classes.description: A view model class that manages the game state for Tic-Tac-Toe, including the game board, current player, game status, and win/draw logic.

classes.name: Player
classes.description: An internal enum representing the two players 'X' and 'O' with logic to get the next player.

classes.name: GameState
classes.description: An internal enum representing the current state of the game: playing, won by a player, or draw.

methods.name: cellTitle(at:)
methods.description: Returns the display string for a cell at a given index, showing 'X', 'O', or empty.

methods.name: tapCell(at:)
methods.description: Handles user tapping a cell, updates the game board, checks for win or draw, and toggles the current player.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the game to initial state, clearing the board and resetting game variables.

methods.name: statusText
methods.description: Provides a string describing the current game status, such as whose turn it is or who won.

methods.name: statusColor
methods.description: Provides a color representing the current game state, used for UI display.
